For almost three years Sam Bell (Sam Rockwell) fulfilled his contract with Lunar Industries, a mining company that operates in the dark side of the moon, extracting Helium 3, a material that has become the main source of energy on Earth.

The company Sam Moon is in the robot-computer named Gerty (voice of Kevin Spacey).

Now standing near the end of his contract time, the isolation in which he lived these years begin to weigh in the life of Sam. The only news we got home and the rest of the world occur through recorded messages from his wife and daughter as the live broadcasts have been hampered by a persistent defect in the satellite communications company.

Increasingly relishing return to the house, he begins to have a sense of fragmentation foreshadowing paranoia. An accident on the lunar surface makes discover the existence of a clone of you, taking you to a disturbance that contributes further to exacerbate his growing paranoia.

"Lunar" is an intelligent scientific thriller that rivals genre classics like 2001: A Space Odyssey.
